summary: This is a transcript of FBI testimony before a federal grand jury in West Palm Beach on May 8, 2007, as part of Operation Leap Year. An FBI agent details interviews with underage girls who performed massages for Jeffrey Epstein, describes grooming patterns, and discusses evidence including phone records, flight manifests, and the roles of Epstein's assistants. This is a transcript of testimony before a federal grand jury in West Palm Beach on May 8, 2007. A law enforcement witness presents evidence related to the enticement and abuse of minor victims Jane Doe #1 and Jane Doe #2 by Jeffrey Epstein, detailing specific overt acts, phone records, payments, and the role of a recruiter/driver.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure under investigation for arranging massages with underage girls at his Palm Beach residence. Described as paying for massages, having specific preferences for young, thin, blonde girls, and grooming victims.

persons.name: Jim Eisenberg
persons.context: A well-known defense attorney in West Palm Beach who was retained by a witness (referred to as 'MN') after she was subpoenaed. Epstein paid for his services.

persons.name: Philip W. May
persons.context: The court reporter authorized to report the sworn testimony before the Federal Grand Jury in West Palm Beach on May 8, 2007.

connections.description: Epstein paid for attorney Jim Eisenberg to represent a witness (MN) in the grand jury investigation.
Epstein is charged with enticement of Jane Doe #1, a minor. Evidence includes her travel to his home, performing a sexual massage for $200, and phone records linking them.
Epstein is charged with enticement of Jane Doe #2, a 14-year-old. Evidence includes payments, sexual activity during a massage, and phone records.
Jane Doe #1 transported Jane Doe #2 to Epstein's house and made phone calls to her to arrange appointments, for which she was paid.

events.title: Immunized Interview of Witness MN
events.description: A key witness (MN) was interviewed by the FBI after being granted immunity. She described performing massages for Epstein starting at age 15/16, being paid $200, and being told to say she was 18.

events.title: FBI First Contact with Witness MN
events.description: The FBI first attempted to contact and interview witness MN as part of the investigation.

events.title: First Contact with Witness MN via Phone Records
events.description: Phone records show Epstein's assistant contacting witness MN's cell phone, establishing she was 15 at the time, contradicting her claim she was 16 when she started.

events.title: Sexual Massage of Jane Doe #1
events.description: Jane Doe #1 traveled to Epstein's Palm Beach home at 358 El Brillo Way and performed a sexual massage for him. She was paid $200.

events.title: Abuse of Jane Doe #2 and Payment
events.description: Jane Doe #2, age 14, was transported to Epstein's home, performed a sexual massage, and was paid $300. Jane Doe #1 was paid $200 for bringing her.

events.title: Epstein's Flight and Attempted Appointment
events.description: Epstein traveled on his Boeing 727 aircraft. Phone records and notes from his trash show he expected an appointment with a victim (likely Jane Doe #2) that was never kept.

events.title: Attempted Enticement of Jane Doe #2
events.description: A series of phone calls and voice mails were made to arrange an appointment for Jane Doe #2, age 14, with Epstein. The appointment was noted but she did not go.

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: A law enforcement witness testified before the federal grand jury in West Palm Beach, presenting evidence on multiple counts against Epstein.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida (Jeffrey Epstein's residence)
West Palm Beach, Florida (Location of FBI office and grand jury)
Palm Beach County, State of Florida
358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: A key witness (MN) was granted immunity before agreeing to be interviewed. She admitted to performing massages for Epstein starting at age 15/16 and being paid $200.
The witness stated she was told to say she was 18, had a fake ID, and instructed other girls she recruited to also lie about their age.
Phone records and evidence show Epstein's assistants called girls to set up massage appointments, and these calls coincided with Epstein's travel.
An expert consulted by the FBI discussed 'compliant victims' and 'grooming' techniques, which were observed in Epstein's interactions with the girls, starting with compliments and escalating demands.
Epstein paid for the defense attorney (Jim Eisenberg) representing the immunized witness.
Jane Doe #1 was recruited on a beach to perform massages for Epstein for money.
Jane Doe #2 was 14 years old at the time of the alleged abuse in February 2005.
Evidence includes phone records, flight manifests, victim statements, trash pulls revealing notes on Epstein's stationery, and controlled calls by police.
A recruiter/driver (name redacted) admitted to recruiting and driving for Epstein.
Epstein allegedly stated a preference for younger girls, saying 'The younger, the better.'
